adrFormatAddress: 353 West St, New York, NY 10014, USA

editorialSummary.text: Athletic complex & garage housed in a sprawling former pier building with shoreline views.

originalText.text:
A soccer game at Pier 40 is not just about the sport. It's an urban symphony where the pounding rhythm of soccer boots meets the serenity of a New York skyline backdrop. Nestled in the heart of downtown Manhattan, Pier 40 combines the thrill of the game with unbeatable views of the World Trade Center, making it a memorable sporting experience.

The turf at Pier 40 is commendably maintained, providing a nice, even playing surface that every soccer enthusiast will appreciate. Whether you're engaging in a competitive match or simply kicking the ball around with friends, the field is ideal for a variety of soccer exploits.

Perhaps the most significant feature of Pier 40 is its spectacular view. The sight of the majestic World Trade Center towering over the city skyline offers a unique backdrop to the field, making every game here a picture-perfect event.

Another perk that Pier 40 provides is its availability of parking - a rare luxury in the bustling city of Manhattan. This added convenience makes planning your games here even more appealing, saving you from the often stressful search for street parking.

However, the Pier 40 experience isn't without its downsides. The facilities, namely the bathrooms and vending machines, need some serious TLC. The bathroom facilities seem to have been stuck in the past and could use a facelift and regular maintenance checks. As for the vending machines, they often seem to have a mind of their own, sometimes denying you that much-needed post-match snack.

Despite these minor hiccups, Pier 40 remains a hidden gem for soccer lovers. Its urban charm, fantastic turf, and stunning views make it a unique sporting venue that captures the spirit of Manhattan. With some attention to its amenities, Pier 40 has the potential to be an unmatched urban soccer haven.

In conclusion, if you love the beautiful game and aren't too picky about post-match conveniences, Pier 40 is the place to be. After all, where else can you score a goal with the World Trade Center as your witness?

originalText.text: Saw Dixon live on a boat party. Gotta say the yacht itself was enormous. Vibe was 100!! I would definitely come back here for another DJ set.

text.text: Saw Dixon live on a boat party. Gotta say the yacht itself was enormous. Vibe was 100!! I would definitely come back here for another DJ set.

originalText.text:
Need a Date Night?  Highly recommend dinner cruise on the Cornucopia..This 3 hour dinner cruise is worth every penny and than some!
We were greeted by the boat   staff with a smile and a Enjoy the Night... which we did, OMG did we ever!! The host seated us at our table because we got there early we were able to pick out our seats.. facing the windows.

The dinner was a buffet style. The dinner served would have taken hours to serve everyone Dinner was fabulous! You think a buffet would be bland and just ordinary food...Nope, not this one!! I wish I would have taken a picture of the actually setup of the buffet but I did take a pic of what was served on my plate..it looks like alot but I only sampled a little bit and didn't get everything...(see pic) As we were eating, the boat pushed off from the dock and the sun was setting for the night! The weather was perfect, the staff was phenomenal and the cruise was a memory that will not be soon forgotten.
